questions.question: When you use details or evidence in a text to draw a conclusion, you ___________.

choices.answer: summarize
problem solve
identify the main idea
infer
understanding exactly what the text says
using logic to read between the lines
determining what's a fact and what's anopinion
using word parts to decode an unknownword
make an educated guess about things thataren't written down
look for the very small print in between thelines of a book
stop and think about each line before youread on
read two things at once

questions.question: Which statement about an inference is correct?

choices.answer: An inference is not based on any evidence.
An inference is based only on what a textsays.
An inference always turns out to be right.
An inference requires that you use clues.

questions.question: A girl tells you her cat's name is Grumpy Gus. You might infer that the cat _________.

choices.answer: is a kitten
is often in a bad mood
is large
is in your backyard

questions.question: Ben's auditioning for the school play.He's been fine all day, but gets sick before auditioning.

choices.answer: he is nervous about the audition
he is happy about the audition
he never gets sick
he is allergic to peanuts

questions.question: Your mother is wearing a rain coat. When she comes inside, she puts down an umbrella.

choices.answer: she is picking your brother up from school
she needs to go grocery shopping
it is raining outside
it is May

questions.question: Terrence is camping. It is dry and windy out. He falls asleep near theblazing campfire.

choices.answer: There will be a hurricane.
Someone will stop by.
An animal will leap into the flames.
The fire may spread.
